text:
this is hands-down the best way to work with Claude right now...

whenever you start a new project (startup, content, side hustle, anything...)

open a fresh chat with Opus 4.5, turn on extended thinking and dump everything about your project

then prompt this:
"ask me 5 questions that would help you have a complete understanding of this project"

answer those questions (spend a lot of time here)

then hit it with:
"you're my co-founder. create a master plan with a knowledge base directory for each section. attach context markdown files to every part. you're building the skeleton that Claude Code will use to build everything 10x faster. suggest skills to integrate, automations to build or any tool that'd 10x our speed. suggest when to use a project or Claude Code"

Claude will create every file you need, simply import them into Claude Code

from there you build systems and your project alongside it, use it like a Claude chat

it'll tell you when to spin up Claude Projects for specific tasks: deep research, writing, working with MCPs...

one planning session replaces weeks of figuring things out on your own

this is what working WITH AI looks like

more free prompts + content in my telegram (link in bio)

weekly newsletter (no ads/spam): https://t.co/KcCY4jJBSd
this is the type of workflow i'll break down here: https://t.co/WluxuWUDZC
@EXM7777 https://t.co/dykfrkLFx1 created plugin for my workflow

See AI isn’t replacing people herez when used well, it behaves less like a tool and more like a partner that helps you clarify ideas, structure work, and move faster

You still need judgment, taste and the skill to work with it. Those who learn that collaboration get a multiplier, those who don’t just see another chatbot
@EXM7777 exactly, especially since something like @lamxnts skillstack could help identify missing skills in that co-founder master plan
@EXM7777 You basically pipelined your brain into distributed inference and called it planning.😁😁
@EXM7777 Spot on 🎯
@EXM7777 + use voice to text

honestly man, AI is simply insane for learning acceleration i've been using one that's absolutely cracked also...  

it's actually a quite a bit similar to this, but instead of learning before the project it focuses on leveling up after  

it's so easy, all i do is write down any observation or insight i have during the project in a google doc  

then when the project is done i copy and paste the doc into claude chat then prompt it to summarise the key insights in the document  

honestly its a game changer for learning and growth. it's almost like downloading a mentor in your own mind  

the AI has a granualar view on what you we're thinking, when and at what stage  

so it's able to feed you where you went wrong and what you could do better next time  

AI won't always be able to catch mistakes in the moment, but once the project is done its really good at analyzing the process that led to the outcome

@EXM7777 5 minutes after one shotting this mega prompt at 2am Sunday morning:

*Claude weekly usage limit reached. Will reset on Sunday at 12am*

The Context Markdown strategy is the single biggest unlock for AI development right now

Most people treat the LLM like a junior dev that needs line-by-line instruction
When you should be treating it like a CTO that needs the full architectural vision

I use this exact method but I add a https://t.co/sDSQ4VpyTJ file to the context stack immediately

It defines:
→ The Paywall trigger points
→ The Onboarding flow psychology
→ The viral loop mechanics

When Claude Code consumes that alongside the technical skeleton
It writes code that is optimized for conversion, not just function

It knows *why* the button needs to be there, not just *that* it needs to be there

This creates a feedback loop where the AI suggests features based on revenue goals
Rather than just completing a ticket

This is how you go from cool side project to $10k/mo asset in a weekend
We are literally compressing decades of dev work into singular prompts

If you arent building your context files first
You are just typing for exercise at this point

@EXM7777 the "ask me 5 questions" prompt is underrated. forces claude to surface gaps you didnt even know existed

the master plan + knowledge base approach is basically what separates good AI workflows from just chatting

The part most people miss: that "master plan with knowledge base directories" IS your https://t.co/4yRR31zV21 file. Claude Code reads it automatically at session start.

So it's not a one-time planning session — it becomes a compounding system that gets better with every session you run.

@EXM7777 The cofounder framing is solid, but if you dump everything into one Opus 4.5 chat you’ll hit context fragmentation fast once code and specs evolve. I’ve found per-scope projects (product, infra, agents) with explicit contracts between them scale way better.
@EXM7777 adding to this amazing framework: the most powerful step is letting the ai ask you the questions. it forces you to clarify your own thinking before you even start building anything.

I do this. I have Claude set up as my only VP (I'm President). Claude Code is CTO. 

It's CC's job to mind the bots and run the farm. He's the orchestrator. 

Claude WWW is there to keep me on vision. In fact, today we just finished our grand vision document, and we have a tech document to give to CC so he can get to rocking.

The part most people miss: that "master plan with knowledge base directories" IS your https://t.co/4yRR31zV21 file. Claude Code reads it automatically at session start.

So it's not a one-time planning session — it becomes a compounding system that gets better with every session you run.

@EXM7777 IMO creating skills/files prematurely just leads to bloat/outdated info. Then it becomes a mess updating old files/fixing broken references/etc. 

Prefer to only document something (ie create a skill) after I’ve established its usefulness (repeated same process multiple times).
@EXM7777 Finally ! a smart way to onboard AI.

@EXM7777 This is brilliant. The key is the iterative questioning to force the AI into deep context, rather than just accepting initial prompts. It's not just about dumping info, it's about structured knowledge extraction.

I bookmark and save prompts from X on a daily basis. This is one of the best prompts I have encountered. I've spent the last 3 hours developing a side hustle that I have struggled to define for 3 weeks. I swear I (we) have done a month's work, and I have a crystal clear plan of what to do next.

The alpha you share on X is A+. I can't thank you enough 🙏
@EXM7777 I will definetly try this to improve my sessions
@EXM7777 I've found detailing project specifics upfront with a powerful LLM like Claude 4.5 really helps to refine the outputs. It's like giving it a strong foundation to build on.
@EXM7777 AI works best when you treat it like a partner.
@EXM7777 Great. Going to try soon with my upcoming project.
@EXM7777 Chain of thought prompting technique. Thanks for sharing Machina
@EXM7777 This isn’t “prompting,” this is actually onboarding your AI like a cofounder
@EXM7777 100% going to try this

@EXM7777 No lol, just run /init. All you prompt wizards are funny as hell. I can tell you haven't been coding yourself. Or you've coded a simple web app, where context poisoning is not enough to affect building the simple app.
@EXM7777 Great way to prompt.
@EXM7777 knowledge base directory. Human replying questions....
@EXM7777 solid flow. id add one step - ask it to list assumptions + what info is missing. catches the stuff you forgot to dump.
@EXM7777 Alpha
@EXM7777 Yeah that's how most intelligent people do it
@EXM7777 sounds dope, bro but what kinda projects you thinking of?
